meanings.definition: To acclimate or adapt to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to the mountains, she started climatizing to the colder weather.
meanings.sent2: The birds are climatizing to the changing seasons by growing thicker feathers.
meanings.sent3: The penguin joked that he was climatizing to the tropical heat by wearing a tiny sunhat.
meanings.sent4: Her skin was climatizing to the harsh sun, turning a shade darker each day.
meanings.sent5: Climatizing to the icy winds felt like a chilly adventure for the explorer.

meanings.definition: The process of adjusting to a different climate.
meanings.sent1: Climatizing can be challenging when moving from a warm to a cold region.
meanings.sent2: The climatizing of the plants in the greenhouse is carefully monitored by the botanist.
meanings.sent3: The climatizing of the office space to combat the summer heat involved installing new fans.
meanings.sent4: The climatizing of the house for winter involved adding extra insulation to keep the warmth in.
meanings.sent5: The climatizing of the desert animals to the scorching sun is a fascinating process to observe.

meanings.definition: To make suitable for a particular climate.
meanings.sent1: The gardener was climatizing the soil by adding nutrients for the plants to thrive.
meanings.sent2: Climatizing the car for the hot summer involved tinting the windows to keep it cool.
meanings.sent3: She was climatizing the recipe to suit the colder climate by adding more warming spices.
meanings.sent4: The architect was climatizing the building design to withstand the strong coastal winds.
meanings.sent5: Climatizing the clothing for the Arctic expedition meant adding layers for insulation.
